description.value: Peach trees are notoriously finicky when it comes to planting, demanding patience and knowledge. Their seeds need to be kept in cold storage for an extended period before theyâ€™re ready for planting. This period of dormancy ensures that when the time comes to plant, the seed will sprout and grow into a healthy tree. Even a small mistake in timing or storage can result in failure, which is why only the most experienced farmhands and herbalists take on the responsibility of planting the pits.
